Visit Us                                                                                        The NYU School of Professional Studies Website    Faculty    Degrees    Professional Certificates    Upcoming Events        Search Courses     Credit Course     Non-Credit Course          Site    Noncredit Courses    Faculty                                                                                                                                 About             History & Mission The School and NYC Message from the Dean Academic Accreditation Administration Newsroom The School Community Convocation Visual Identity and Editorial Guidelines School Events                   Admissions             Graduate Admissions Undergraduate Admissions Events You@NYU Apply                   Academics             Academic Departments Academic Policies and Procedures Academic Accreditation Degree Programs Graduate Programs Undergraduate Programs Online Offerings Diploma Program Admissions  High School Academy Noncredit Offerings Course Search Certificates Intensives New Courses Online Offerings Professional Advantage Programs Information Sessions  Online Offerings                   Noncredit                 Faculty             Office of Faculty Affairs Faculty Search                   Career             About For Students For Employers For Alumni For Faculty                   Conferences & Events                 Giving                 Alumni             Alumni Community Stay Connected Alumni Benefits and Services Alumni Award Programs and Events                                                   Visit Us                                      Visit Us                         We know that the NYU School of Professional Studies is a great place to get an incredible education. Thousands of professionally-driven students from an array of life paths choose to enroll in our programs and leave satisfied, having earned a reputable and valuable degree. For this reason, we would love for you to come experience the NYU community for yourself.   Get to know our student body in person. Meet with our admissions staff about our wide range of programs. Tour our LEED-certified building. Wander through the tree-lined cobblestone streets on campus. Give in to the creative energy of the city.   Simply contact the Office of Admissions to arrange a time. We look forward to finding out more about you.            NYU School of Professional Studies Locations        The NYU School of Professional Studies classes are held at four convenient locations listed below. The location at 7 East 12th Street also houses the Office of Admissions.       The NYU School of Professional Studies Building at 7 East 12th Street   The Washington Square campus in Greenwich Village   The Midtown Graduate Center at 11 West 42nd Street   The Woolworth Building at 15 Barclay Street in downtown Manhattan     Please refer to the NYU campus map [PDF] for a more detailed view of our locations.             Expand All   Collapse All          7 East 12th Street        The NYU School of Professional Studies building at 7 East 12th Street serves as the on-campus home for the School's administrative offices and programs listed below.   At This Location       Office of Admissions     Paul McGhee Division   Tisch Center for Hospitality and Tourism   Tisch Institute for Sports Management, Media, and Business   Foreign Languages, Translation and Interpreting   American Language Institute (ALI) Administrative Offices   Humanities, Arts, and Writing   Administrative Offices     Getting Here   By Subway  Take the L, N, Q, R, 4, 5, or 6 line to the Union Square-14th Street stop.   By Train  From Penn Station, take the 1, 2, or 3 subway line to the 14th Street stop.  From Grand Central Terminal, take the 4 or 5 subway line to the Union Square-14th Street stop.  Take a PATH train to the 14th Street Station.   By Bus  From Broadway, take the No. 1 or 3 bus to the 5th Av-W. 12th stop.             Woolworth Building (15 Barclay Street)        15 Barclay Street, (the historic Woolworth Building), houses administrative offices, and classroom facilities for the programs listed below. The NYU School of Professional Studies occupies the 2nd, 3rd, and 4th floor of the building. All students need a valid NYU ID to enter; all visitors may register at the desk in the lobby.   At This Location     The Center for Global Affairs   American Language Institute (ALI)       Getting Here   By Subway  Take the 2 or 3 line to the Park Place stop.  Take the 4, 5, 6, or R line to the Brooklyn Bridge-City Hall stop.  Take the A or C line to the Chambers Street stop.     By Train  From Penn Station, take the 2 or 3 subway line to the Park Place stop or the A or C to Chambers Street.  From Grand Central Terminal, take the 4, 5, 6, or R subway line to the Brooklyn Bridge-City Hall stop.  Take a PATH train to the World Trade Center Station.   By Bus  From Broadway, take the No. 5 bus to the City Hall stop.               Washington Square Campus        Many NYU School of Professional Studies classes meet on the Washington Square campus, the center of NYU in the heart of Greenwich Village. One of the City's most creative and energetic communities, the Village is an historic neighborhood that has attracted generations of writers, musicians, artists, and intellectuals.   At This Location     The Paul McGhee Division (select courses)   M.S. in Fundraising and Grantmaking     Getting Here   By Subway  Take the 6 line to the Astor Place stop.  Take the N or R line to the 8th Street stop (at Broadway).  Take the A, B, C, D, E, F, or M line to the West 4th Street-Washington Square stop.  Take the 1 line to the Christopher Street-Sheridan Square stop.   By Train   From Penn Station, take the A, B, C, D, E, F, or M subway line to the West 4th Street stop or the 1 to Christopher Street.  From Grand Central Terminal, take the 6 subway line to the Astor Place stop.  Take a PATH train to the 9th Street and Avenue of the Americas Station.     By Bus  From Fifth Avenue, take the No. 1, 2, 3, or 5 bus to 8th Street and University Place.  From 8th Street Crosstown take the No. 8 bus to University Place.  From Broadway, take the No. 5 bus to Waverly Place.  From the Avenue of the Americas, take the No. 5 bus to Waverly Place.             NYU Midtown Center (11 West 42nd Street)        At 11 West 42nd Street (the NYU Midtown Center), the NYU School of Professional Studies occupies the 4th, 5th, and 10th floors. Facilities include classrooms, graduate academic department and administrative offices, and the Brause Real Estate Library. The Midtown Center also features a café and a computer lab. All students need a valid NYU ID to enter; all visitors must register at the desk in the lobby.   At This Location     Schack Institute of Real Estate   Center for Publishing   Center for Advanced Digital Applications   NYU School of Professional Studies programs in Human Resource Management and Development ; Integrated Marketing ; Management and Systems ; Public Relations and Corporate Communication ; and Translation   International Student Support Center     Getting Here   By Subway  Take the B, D, F, or M line to the 42nd Street stop (at Avenue of the Americas).  Take the 7 line to the 42nd Street stop (at Fifth Avenue).  Take the 4, 5, or 6 line to the 42nd Street-Grand Central Station stop.  Take the 1, 2, 3, N, Q, or R line to the 42nd Street-Times Square stop.     By Train  From Penn Station, walk outside one block east and take the B, D, F, or M subway line to the 42nd Street stop.  From Grand Central Terminal, walk three blocks west to the NYU Midtown Center.  Take a PATH train to 33rd Street and then take the B, D, F, or M subway line to the 42nd Street stop.     By Bus  From Fifth Avenue take the No. 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, or Q32 bus to 42nd Street.  From Avenue of the Americas, take the No. 5 or 7 bus to 42nd Street.  From Madison Avenue, take the No. 1, 2, 3, or 4 bus to 42nd Street.  From Crosstown take the No. 42 or 104 bus to 42nd Street and Fifth Avenue. We are here to help, and to assist you with your questions and concerns. Choose an option below to receive additional information about our graduate , undergraduate , or noncredit programs .             Graduate Programs     By phone: (212) 998-7100   By e-mail: sps.gradadmissions@nyu.edu   In person: Office of Admissions at 7 East 12th Street, Suite 921, NY, NY 10003  Mon.–Thurs., 9 a.m.–6 p.m. and Fri., 9–5 p.m.   Graduate Admissions Website   Apply Online             Paul McGhee Division Undergraduate Programs     By phone: (212) 998-7100   By e-mail: mcgheeadmissions@nyu.edu   In person: Office of Admissions at 7 East 12th Street, Suite 921, NY, NY 10003  Mon.–Thurs., 9 a.m.–6 p.m. and Fri., 9–5 p.m.   Undergraduate Admissions Website   Apply Online              Request Information         Request Information          Noncredit Programs     By phone: (212) 998-7200  Mon.–Thurs., 9 a.m.–7 p.m.;
